c74object.name: fl.chop~
c74object.digest: Chops input frames into equally sized output frames of a specified size
c74object.description: The size can be set in samples or as a ratio of the length of the input frame. Outputs are formed by chopping the input into consecutive slices of the same length. Any additional input values once all outputs are formed are ignored. If there are insufficient input values to complete all outputs later outputs will be shortened. It is possible for the final output(s) to be empty in this case.

entry.name: /size [double]
entry.description: Sets the size of the output frames.

entry.name: /units [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the units for the size (samples or ratio of the input length [0-1]).
[0] - samples[1] - ratios

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.chop~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.chop~. When set to 0 fl.chop~ forms part of a non-realtime network for performing offline processing in Max message threads. This mode of operation uses buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.chop~ in order to determine distinct processing contexts.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
